intro: Schizotheca rosea, commonly known as the roseleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy floral structures. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized bracts that resemble petals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Schizotheca rosea thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas.
